(a)   The employer
must provide toilets and handwashing facilities (filled with potable water) in
the ratio of 1 for every 20 workers or a fraction thereof to be located within
¼ mile of the work site, or if not feasible, at the point of closest vehicular
access.  Toilet and handwashing facilities shall be accessibly located and in
close proximity to each other.  No requirement exists to provide separate
toilet facilities for male and female workers under the field sanitation
standard.  29 CFR 1928.110(c)(2)(i),(iii),& (iv) (b)   Toilets must be
ventilated to reduce heat and noxious odors inside the facility, be adequately
screened, and have self-closing doors that can be latched from the inside so as
to deter the entry of pests and to afford privacy to the user. 29 CFR 1928.110(c)(ii) (c)   The handwashing
facilities must include soap, potable water and single-use towels in amounts to
satisfy needs.  Pre-moistened towelettes, hand-sanitizers, nor any waterless
handcleaning system are not acceptable. 29 CFR 1928.110(b)52 Fed. Reg. 16091-16092Wage and Hour Opinion Letter April 17, 2001Wage and Hour Opinion Letter June 5, 1998.

(a)   The employer must provide toilets and handwashing facilities (filled with potable water) in the ratio of 1 for every 20 workers or a fraction thereof to be located within ¼ mile of the work site, or if not feasible, at the point of closest vehicular access.  Toilet and handwashing facilities shall be accessibly located and in close proximity to each other.  No requirement exists to provide separate toilet facilities for male and female workers under the field sanitation standard.

 

29 CFR 1928.110(c)(2)(i),(iii),& (iv)

 

(b)   Toilets must be ventilated to reduce heat and noxious odors inside the facility, be adequately screened, and have self-closing doors that can be latched from the inside so as to deter the entry of pests and to afford privacy to the user.

 

29 CFR 1928.110(c)(ii)

 

(c)   The handwashing facilities must include soap, potable water and single-use towels in amounts to satisfy needs.  Pre-moistened towelettes, hand-sanitizers, nor any waterless handcleaning system are not acceptable.

 

29 CFR 1928.110(b)

52 Fed. Reg. 16091-16092
